tit.j: 太政官布告・太政官達
tit.cmt: ここはタイトル部分にあたりますので補足説明をせず、後列の本文で説明する形をとっています。

sen.j: 太政官布告（だじょうかんふこく）・太政官達（だじょうかんたっし）とは、ともに太政官明治維新の太政官によって公布された明治時代初期の法令の形式である。
sen.e: The Dajokan Fukoku and the Dajokan Tasshi were both a form of law promulgated by the Dajokan (Grand Council of State) during the early Meiji period.
sen.cmt: 原文を「太政官布告（だじょうかんふこく）・太政官達（だじょうかんたっし）とはともに太政官によって公布された明治時代初期の法令の形式である。」であるものとして訳出しました。
sen.e: Both the Dajokan Fukoku and the Dajokan Tasshi were a form of law promulgated by the Dajokan (Grand Council of State) during the early Meiji period.
sen.cmt: 主語をboth A and Bの形にする方が自然です。
sen.e: Both the Dajokan Fukoku and the Dajokan Tasshi were a form of law promulgated by the Dajokan (Grand Council of State) during the early Meiji period.

sen.j: 太政官布告、太政官達は、いずれも、明治時代初期に最高官庁として設置された太政官明治維新の太政官によって公布された法令の形式である。
sen.e: The Dajokan Fukoku and the Dajokan Tasshi were both a form of law during the early Meiji period, promulgated by the supreme government office called Dajokan (Grand Council of State), which was newly established after the Meiji Restoration.
sen.cmt: 原文を「太政官布告、太政官達は、いずれも、明治時代初期に最高官庁として設置された太政官によって公布された法令の形式である。」であるものとして訳出しました。
sen.e: Both the Dajokan Fukoku and the Dajokan Tasshi were a form of law during the early Meiji period, promulgated by the supreme government office called Dajokan (Grand Council of State), which was newly established after the Meiji Restoration.
sen.cmt: 主語をboth A and Bの形にする方が自然です。
sen.e: Both the Dajokan Fukoku and the Dajokan Tasshi were a form of law during the early Meiji period, promulgated by the supreme government office called Dajokan (Grand Council of State), which was newly established after the Meiji Restoration.

sen.j: 布告と達の区別については、当初から厳密な区別はなかったが、1873年（明治6年）には、各官庁及び官員に対する訓令としての意味を持つものを「太政官達」、全国一般へ布告すべきものを「太政官布告」として区別することを定めた（明治6年太政官布告第254号）。
sen.e: There had been no clear distinction made between the two types of law until 1873, when it was defined to release directives for government offices and their personnel under the name of 'Dajokan Tasshi,' and for the public under the name of 'Dajokan Fukoku' (Dajokan Fukoku No. 254 of 1873).

There had been no clear distinction made between the two types of law until 1873, when it was decided to release directives for government offices and their personnel under the name of 'Dajokan Tasshi,' and for the public under the name of 'Dajokan Fukoku' (Dajokan Fukoku No. 254 of 1873).
sen.cmt: it is defined to～という構文は用いられません。
sen.e: There had been no clear distinction made between the two types of law until 1873, when it was decided to release directives for government offices and their personnel under the name of 'Dajokan Tasshi,' and for the public under the name of 'Dajokan Fukoku' (Dajokan Fukoku No. 254 of 1873).

sen.j: しかし、実際の取扱いとしては、その後もそのような区別が厳密にされていたとは言い難く、一般国民を拘束する内容を持つものであっても太政官達の形式により定めたものもあった。
sen.e: Yet the rule was apparently not strictly applied, as in practice the Dajokan Tasshi form was still used to promulgate binding regulations intended for the public.
Yet the rule was apparently not strictly applied, as in practice the Dajokan Tasshi form was still used to promulgate binding regulations intended for the public.
Yet the rule was apparently not strictly applied, as in practice the Dajokan Tasshi form was still used to promulgate binding regulations intended for the public.

sen.j: また、明治初期の国家意思形成の不統一性の問題もあり、規制対象を同じくする法令が何度も公布されたり、法令の名称についても、「法」、「条例」、「規則」、「律」など様々であった。
sen.e: The early Meiji government internally lacked appropriate means of establishing a uniform direction over state governance, and there were laws and ordinances repeatedly issued with overlapping subjects, using various names for the laws, such as 'act,' 'bylaw,' 'order' and 'code.'

The early Meiji government internally lacked appropriate means of establishing a uniform direction over state governance, and there were laws and ordinances repeatedly issued with overlapping subjects, using various names for the laws, such as 'act,' 'bylaw,' 'order' and 'code.'

The early Meiji government internally lacked appropriate means of establishing a uniform direction over state governance, and there were laws and ordinances repeatedly issued with overlapping subjects, using various names for the laws, such as 'act,' 'bylaw,' 'order' and 'code.'

sen.j: また、太政官名義ではなくその下部組織の名義で公布された法令もあったが、効力関係に上下はなかったとされている。
sen.e: There were also laws issued not under the name of Dajokan itself but under the name of its sub-organizations, without their legal order of precedence defined.
There were also laws issued not under the name of Dajokan itself but under the name of its sub-organizations, without their legal order of precedence defined.
There were also laws issued not under the name of Dajokan itself but under the name of its sub-organizations, without their legal order of precedence defined.

sen.j: 1885年（明治18年）12月22日、内閣 (日本)制が発足したことに伴い、太政官制は廃止された。
sen.e: The Dajokan system was abolished upon the establishment of Meiji cabinet on December 22, 1885.
The Dajokan system was abolished upon the establishment of Meiji cabinet on December 22, 1885.
The Dajokan system was abolished upon the establishment of Meiji cabinet on December 22, 1885.

sen.j: 翌1886年（明治19年）2月26日には、法令の効力や形式を定式化するため、公文式 (勅令)（明治19年勅令第1号）が制定され、太政官布告・太政官達という法形式は廃止された。
sen.e: The Kobun-shiki (official style) Chokurei (Imperial Ordinance) No. 1 of February 26, 1886 was promulgated to formalize the validity and style of laws, and abolish the usage of Dajokan Fukoku and Tasshi styles of law.
sen.cmt: 法務省提供の"Japan Law Translation" (http://www.japaneselawtranslation.go.jp/) 「勅令」を"Imperial Ordinance" としていますので、こちらを採用しました。
sen.e: The Kobun-shiki (official style) Chokurei (Imperial Ordinance) No. 1 of February 26, 1886 was promulgated to formalize the validity and style of laws, and abolish the usage of Dajokan Fukoku and Tasshi styles of law.

The Kobun-shiki (official style) Chokurei (Imperial Ordinance) No. 1 of February 26, 1886 was promulgated to formalize the validity and style of laws, and abolish the usage of Dajokan Fukoku and Tasshi styles of law.

sen.j: 公文式施行以前に公布された太政官布告・太政官達は、以後に成立した法令に反しない限り、その効力を保有する。
sen.e: Any Dajokan Fukoku or Tasshi issued prior to the establishment of Kobun-shiki system remains valid unless it becomes contradicting to a law promulgated afterwards.
Any Dajokan Fukoku or Tasshi issued prior to the establishment of Kobun-shiki system remains valid unless it contradicts a law promulgated afterwards.
sen.cmt: become contradictingという表現は一般的ではありません。動詞contradictで表す方が簡潔です。
sen.e: Any Dajokan Fukoku or Tasshi issued prior to the establishment of Kobun-shiki system remains valid unless it contradicts a law promulgated afterwards.

sen.j: 1889年（明治22年）に公布された大日本帝国憲法（明治憲法）には、内容が違憲でない限り有効なものとして扱う旨の明文の規定があった（76条1項）。
sen.e: The Constitution of the Empire of Japan (the Meiji Constitution) promulgated in 1889 expressly provided that any existing Dajokan Fukoku or Tasshi were valid unless it was against the Constitution (Article 76, Paragraph 1).

The Constitution of the Empire of Japan (the Meiji Constitution) promulgated in 1889 expressly provided that any existing Dajokan Fukoku or Tasshi was valid unless it was against the Constitution (Article 76, Paragraph 1).
sen.cmt: FukokuもTasshiも単数形・複数形の両方で使われているようですが、ここでは後でitで受けていることから単数扱いと判断されます。
sen.e: The Constitution of the Empire of Japan (the Meiji Constitution) promulgated in 1889 expressly provided that any existing Dajokan Fukoku or Tasshi was valid unless it was against the Constitution (Article 76, Paragraph 1).

sen.j: したがって、太政官布告・達が対象が明治憲法下で法律事項とされる場合（天皇に立法権があるが、帝国議会の協賛を必要とする）には法律としての効力を有し、命令事項である場合は命令 (法律)としての効力を有するものとされた。
sen.e: Thus, each Dajokan Fukoku and Tasshi was classified into either a law (laws under the Meiji Constitution were legislated by the Emperor with the approval of the Imperial Diet) category or an order category defined by the Meiji Constitution, and was interpreted as valid with corresponding effects under the Constitution.

Thus, Dajokan Fukoku or Tasshi stipulating matters which should be stipulated by law (which should be legislated by the Emperor with the approval of the Imperial Diet) under the Meiji Constitution was interpreted to be valid as a law, while Dajokan Fukoku or Tasshi stipulating matters which should be stipulated by an order was interpreted to be valid as an order.
sen.cmt: 「法律事項」「命令事項」の訳出が不十分です。
sen.e: Thus, Dajokan Fukoku or Tasshi stipulating matters which should be stipulated by law (which should be legislated by the Emperor with the approval of the Imperial Diet) under the Meiji Constitution was interpreted to be valid as a law, while Dajokan Fukoku or Tasshi stipulating matters which should be stipulated by an order was interpreted to be valid as an order.

sen.j: 大日本帝国憲法
sen.e: Constitution of the Empire of Japan
Constitution of the Empire of Japan
Constitution of the Empire of Japan

sen.j: 第76条
sen.e: Article 76
Article 76
Article 76

sen.j: 法律規則命令又ハ何等ノ名稱ヲ用ヰタルニ拘ラス此ノ憲法ニ矛盾セサル現行ノ法令ハ總テ遵由ノ効力ヲ有ス
sen.e: Existing legal enactments, such as laws, regulations, Ordinances, or by whatever names they may be called, shall, so far as they do not conflict with the present Constitution, continue in force.
sen.cmt: 国会図書館掲載の訳文を使用しました。 http://www.ndl.go.jp/constitution/e/etc/c02.html#s7
sen.e: Existing legal enactments, such as laws, regulations, Ordinances, or by whatever names they may be called, shall, so far as they do not conflict with the present Constitution, continue in force.
Existing legal enactments, such as laws, regulations, Ordinances, or by whatever names they may be called, shall, so far as they do not conflict with the present Constitution, continue in force.

sen.j: 1946年（昭和21年）に公布された日本国憲法には、同憲法施行前の法令の効力に関する明文の規定はない。
sen.e: There is no express provision in the Constitution of Japan promulgated in 1946, related to the validity of laws previously established.
There is no express provision in the Constitution of Japan promulgated in 1946, related to the validity of laws previously established.
There is no express provision in the Constitution of Japan promulgated in 1946, related to the validity of laws previously established.

sen.j: しかし、解釈上、明治憲法下で法律事項とされていたものは日本国憲法下でも法律としての効力を有するものとされている。
sen.e: Nevertheless, if a law under the Meiji Constitution can be classified as a law under the current Constitution as well, it is interpreted that such law is still valid.
Nevertheless, if a law under the Meiji Constitution can be classified as a law under the current Constitution as well, it is interpreted that such law is still valid.
Nevertheless, if a law under the Meiji Constitution can be classified as a law under the current Constitution as well, it is interpreted that such law is still valid.

sen.j: これに対し、明治憲法下で命令事項とされていたものは、それが日本国憲法下でも命令事項である場合は引き続き命令としての効力を有するが、法律事項である場合は原則として1947年12月31日限りでその効力が打ち切られた（日本国憲法施行の際現に効力を有する命令の規定の効力等に関する法律1条）。
sen.e: A Meiji Constitution order, however, is deemed as valid if only it can be classified as an order under the current Constitution as well, whereas if such order falls into a law category under the current Constitution, its validity is usually deemed to have lost on December 31, 1947 (Act on Effect, etc. of Provisions of Orders Effective as of Time of Enforcement of the Constitution of Japan, Article 1).
sen.cmt: 法令の名称の訳は、法務省提供の"Japan Law Translation" (http://www.japaneselawtranslation.go.jp/) に掲載の名称としました。
sen.e: An order under the Meiji Constitution, however, is deemed valid if only it stipulates matters which should be stipulated by an order under the current Constitution as well, whereas if such an order stipulates matters which should be stipulated by law under the current Constitution, it ceased to be effective in principle on December 31, 1947 (Act on Effect, etc. of Provisions of Orders Effective as of Time of Enforcement of the Constitution of Japan, Article 1).
sen.cmt: 「法律事項」「命令事項」の訳出が不十分です。また「効力が打ち切られたとみなされる」とは書かれていないのでis deemed toは不要です。
sen.e: An order under the Meiji Constitution, however, is deemed valid if only it stipulates matters which should be stipulated by an order under the current Constitution as well, whereas if such an order stipulates matters which should be stipulated by law under the current Constitution, it ceased to be effective in principle on December 31, 1947 (Act on Effect, etc. of Provisions of Orders Effective as of Time of Enforcement of the Constitution of Japan, Article 1).

sen.j: ただ、前述した明治初期における国家意思形成の不統一性の問題や、規制対象を同じくする法令が何度も公布されたこともあり、布告・達が後の法令で明示的に廃止されなかった場合は、後に内容が矛盾する法令が制定されたとの解釈により効力を失ったのか否か疑義が生じたものもある。
sen.e: Because of the confusion within the early Meiji government as stated above which led to many laws being issued for overlapping subjects, doubts arose related to the validity in some cases where newer laws were put into effect with provisions contradicting to preceding Dajokan Fukoku or Tasshi which had not been expressly abolished.

Because of the confusion within the early Meiji government as stated above which had led to many laws being issued for overlapping subjects, it was sometiimes doubtful whether Dajokan Fukoku or Tasshi was deemed to cease to be effective due to establishment of a new contradicting law, in cases where such Fukoku or Tasshi had not been expressly abolished.
sen.cmt: 原文の内容が英語で十分に表現されていません。
sen.e: Because of the confusion within the early Meiji government as stated above which had led to many laws being issued for overlapping subjects, it was sometiimes doubtful whether Dajokan Fukoku or Tasshi was deemed to cease to be effective due to establishment of a new contradicting law, in cases where such Fukoku or Tasshi had not been expressly abolished.

tit.j: 現行法令として有効と解される太政官布告・太政官達
tit.e: Dajokan Fukoku and Tasshi which are interpreted to be currently in effect
Dajokan Fukoku and Tasshi which are interpreted to be currently in effect
Dajokan Fukoku and Tasshi which are interpreted to be currently in effect

sen.j: 2009年（平成21年）5月現在、現行法令としての効力を有すると解される太政官布告・太政官達は、法令データ提供システムには11件、日本法令索引には10件が掲載されている。
sen.e: As of May 2009, there are 11 Dajokan Fukoku and Tasshi listed as currently effective on the Japan Laws and Regulations Data Service System (法令データ提供システム), or 10 according to the Japan Laws and Regulations Index (日本法令索引).
sen.cmt: 原文に「法令データ提供システム」(総務省提供）および「日本法令索引」（国会図書館提供）を補い、訳出しました。なお、どちらにも正式な英語の名称らしきものが見当たらなかったため、原文に近い訳語で訳出し、意図的に日本語を残しました。英文読者向けには "provided by Ministry of Internal Affairs and Communications", "provided by the National Diet Library" などを付けた方がよいかもしれません。
sen.e: As of May 2009, there are 11 Dajokan Fukoku and Tasshi listed as currently effective on the Japan Laws and Regulations Data Service System (法令データ提供システム), or 10 according to the Japan Laws and Regulations Index (日本法令索引).

As of May 2009, there are 11 Dajokan Fukoku and Tasshi listed as currently effective on the Japan Laws and Regulations Data Service System (法令データ提供システム), or 10 according to the Japan Laws and Regulations Index (日本法令索引).

sen.j: ただ、効力が存続しているか否か解釈が分かれるものもあるため、掲載されている布告・達には若干違いがある。
sen.e: The Fukoku and Tasshi listed by the two databases above are not the same, due to different interpretations as to which are still in effect and which are not.
The Fukoku and Tasshi listed by the two databases above are not the same, due to different interpretations as to which are still in effect and which are not.
The Fukoku and Tasshi listed by the two databases above are not the same, due to different interpretations as to which are still in effect and which are not.

sen.j: 改暦ノ布告（明治5年太政官布告第337号）
sen.e: Promulgation on the Changing of Calendar System (Dajokan Fukoku No. 337 of 1872)
sen.cmt: この行以降に出現する太政官布告の個別名称につきましては、法務省提供の"Japan Law Translation" にも掲載されていませんでしたので、同サイトの単語単位の辞書検索で提示される語をなるべく使用して訳出しました。
sen.e: Promulgation on the Changing of Calendar System (Dajokan Fukoku No. 337 of 1872)
Promulgation on the Changing of Calendar System (Dajokan Fukoku No. 337 of 1872)

sen.j: 太陽太陰暦（旧暦、天保暦）から太陽暦（新暦）への改暦を布告。
sen.e: Change in the calendar system from lunisolar (the Old calendar, or Tenpo calendar) system to solar (the New calendar) system was proclaimed.
Change in the calendar system from lunisolar (the Old calendar, or Tenpo calendar) system to solar (the New calendar) system was proclaimed.
Change in the calendar system from lunisolar (the Old calendar, or Tenpo calendar) system to solar (the New calendar) system was proclaimed.

sen.j: グレゴリオ暦の導入を目的としたが、グレゴリオ暦の重要な要素である「西暦の年が、100で割り切れて、かつ400で割り切れない年は閏年としない。」というルールが脱落していたことが後に判明した。
sen.e: Although the change was intended to introduce Gregorian calendar, it was found later that provision was missing to specify "solar calendar years that are exactly divisible by 100, but not exactly divisible by 400 are not leap years."
sen.cmt: 旧暦、新暦を扱う文章ですのでここでの「西暦」は原文意図にあわせて "solar calendar" としました。閏年はより一般的と思われる "leap year" としました。
sen.e: Although the change was intended to introduce Gregorian calendar, it was found later that provision was missing to specify "solar calendar years that are exactly divisible by 100, but not exactly divisible by 400 are not leap years."

Although the change was intended to introduce Gregorian calendar, it was found later that provision was missing to specify "solar calendar years that are exactly divisible by 100, but not exactly divisible by 400 are not leap years."

sen.j: このため、閏年ニ関スル件（明治31年勅令第90号）により不備が補われた。
sen.e: This was rectified through the Imperial Ordinance on Leap Years (Chokurei No. 90 of 1898).
This was rectified through the Imperial Ordinance on Leap Years (Chokurei No. 90 of 1898).
This was rectified through the Imperial Ordinance on Leap Years (Chokurei No. 90 of 1898).

sen.j: 絞罪器械図式（明治6年太政官布告第65号）
sen.e: Drawings of Equipments for Execution by Hanging (Dajokan Fukoku No. 65 of 1873)
Drawings of Equipments for Execution by Hanging (Dajokan Fukoku No. 65 of 1873)
Drawings of Equipments for Execution by Hanging (Dajokan Fukoku No. 65 of 1873)

sen.j: 死刑の執行に使用する器械の形状を定めた布告。
sen.e: Dimensions of equipments used for judicial execution of death penalty were specified.
Dimensions of equipments used for judicial execution of death penalty were specified.
Dimensions of equipments used for judicial execution of death penalty were specified.

sen.j: 法律としての効力を有するとした最高裁判例がある（最大昭和36年7月19日刑集15巻7号1106頁）。
sen.e: There is a Supreme Court precedent which held that this Fukoku is in effect as a valid law (Supreme Court Grand Bench Keishu Vol. 15, No. 7, p. 1106, 1961).
sen.cmt: Wikipedia より原文末尾の () 内に 「最大昭和36年7月19日刑集15巻7号1106頁」を補いました。
sen.e: There is a Supreme Court precedent which held that this Fukoku is in effect as a valid law (Supreme Court Grand Bench Keishu Vol. 15, No. 7, p. 1106, 1961).
There is a Supreme Court precedent which held that this Fukoku is in effect as a valid law (Supreme Court Grand Bench Keishu Vol. 15, No. 7, p. 1106, 1961).

sen.j: 勲章制定ノ件（明治8年太政官布告第54号） ※2003年（平成15年）4月30日までの旧件名「勲章従軍記章制定ノ件」
sen.e: Establishment of Decoration (Dajokan Fukoku No. 54 of 1845), renamed from 'Announcement on Establishment of Military Medal of Honor' on April 30, 2003
Establishment of Decoration (Dajokan Fukoku No. 54 of 1845), renamed from 'Announcement on Establishment of Military Medal of Honor' on April 30, 2003
Establishment of Decoration (Dajokan Fukoku No. 54 of 1845), renamed from 'Announcement on Establishment of Military Medal of Honor' on April 30, 2003

sen.j: 栄典の一種である勲章について定めた布告。
sen.e: Awarding of decorations was proclaimed.
Awarding of decorations was proclaimed.
Awarding of decorations was proclaimed.

sen.j: 行政解釈では政令としての効力を有するとされているため、改正は政令により行われる(2002年（平成14年）8月12日公布の政令第277号による改正)。
sen.e: The proclamation is interpreted as a valid order by administration and therefore is revised by Cabinet Orders (e.g. Revision by Cabinet Order No. 277 on August 12, 2002).
The proclamation is interpreted as a valid order by administration and therefore is revised by Cabinet Orders (e.g. Revision by Cabinet Order No. 277 on August 12, 2002).
The proclamation is interpreted as a valid order by administration and therefore is revised by Cabinet Orders (e.g. Revision by Cabinet Order No. 277 on August 12, 2002).

sen.j: もっとも、憲法学者の間では、栄典の授与は日本国憲法の下では法律事項であるとして、違憲ではないかとする見解も有力である。
sen.e: There are strong opposing views presented by some scholars specialized in constitutional laws, however, in which they assert that awarding of honors should rather be enacted by a law and therefore the current situation is against the Constitution.

There are strong opposing views presented by some scholars specialized in constitutional laws, however, in which they assert that awarding of honors should rather be enacted by a law and therefore the current situation is against the Constitution.

There are strong opposing views presented by some scholars specialized in constitutional laws, however, in which they assert that awarding of honors should rather be enacted by a law and therefore the current situation is against the Constitution.

sen.j: 不用物品等払下ノトキ其管庁所属ノ官吏入札禁止ノ件（明治8年太政官達第152号）
sen.e: Prohibition of Bids on Disposed Governmental Property by Government Official in Charge (Dajokan Tasshi No. 152 of 1845)
Prohibition of Bids on Disposed Governmental Property by Government Official in Charge (Dajokan Tasshi No. 152 of 1845)
Prohibition of Bids on Disposed Governmental Property by Government Official in Charge (Dajokan Tasshi No. 152 of 1845)

sen.j: 国有財産の払い下げにおいて、その監督官庁に所属する公務員（簡単に言えば監督庁職員）の入札を禁じた達。
sen.e: Public employees belonging to a government office (i.e. personnel of the office) which plans to scrap its property are prohibited to take part in bidding for those national properties to be disposed.
Public employees belonging to a government office (i.e. personnel of the office) which plans to scrap its property are prohibited to take part in bidding for those national properties to be disposed.
Public employees belonging to a government office (i.e. personnel of the office) which plans to scrap its property are prohibited to take part in bidding for those national properties to be disposed.

sen.j: 国立国会図書館が運営する日本法令索引では、廃止法令に挙げられている。
sen.e: The Japan Laws and Regulations Index provided by the National Diet Library lists this Tasshi as an abolished law.
sen.cmt: Wikipedia より『運営する「日本法令索引」では』と補足しました。
sen.e: The Japan Laws and Regulations Index provided by the National Diet Library lists this Tasshi as an abolished law.
The Japan Laws and Regulations Index provided by the National Diet Library lists this Tasshi as an abolished law.

sen.j: 国有財産法16条に類似の規定がある。
sen.e: There is a similar provision in the National Property Act, Article 16.
There is a similar provision in the National Property Act, Article 16.
There is a similar provision in the National Property Act, Article 16.

sen.j: 裁判事務心得（明治8年太政官布告第103号）
sen.e: Conduct of Judicial Proceedings (Dajokan Fukoku No. 103 of 1845)
Conduct of Judicial Proceedings (Dajokan Fukoku No. 103 of 1845)
Conduct of Judicial Proceedings (Dajokan Fukoku No. 103 of 1845)

sen.j: 裁判の際の法源の適用原則などを明らかにした布告。
sen.e: This Fukoku defined principles of applicable laws for court proceedings.
This Fukoku defined principles of applicable laws for court proceedings.
This Fukoku defined principles of applicable laws for court proceedings.

sen.j: 法令データ提供システムでは、3条、4条、5条に限って挙げられている。
sen.e: The Japan Laws and Regulations Data Service System lists only Articles 3, 4 and 5.
sen.cmt: 一桁の数ですが法令の条文番号ですので数字を使用しました。
sen.e: The Japan Laws and Regulations Data Service System lists only Articles 3, 4 and 5.
The Japan Laws and Regulations Data Service System lists only Articles 3, 4 and 5.

sen.j: 刑事に関する事項が失効していることは争いはないが、民事に関する事項について現在でも効力が残っているか、残っているとしてその範囲等については争いがある。
sen.e: While it is widely accepted that provisions with regard to criminal proceedings have lost effect, there are disputes over whether the Fukoku remains valid related to civil disputes, and if so, which are the provisions remaining in effect.

While it is widely accepted that provisions with regard to criminal proceedings have lost effect, there are disputes over whether the Fukoku remains valid related to civil disputes, and if so, which are the provisions remaining in effect.

While it is widely accepted that provisions with regard to criminal proceedings have lost effect, there are disputes over whether the Fukoku remains valid related to civil disputes, and if so, which are the provisions remaining in effect.

sen.j: 効力があると解される場合は、法律としての効力があることになる。
sen.e: If any part is in fact interpreted valid, it may be construed as a law.
If any part is in fact interpreted valid, it may be construed as a law.
If any part is in fact interpreted valid, it may be construed as a law.

sen.j: 大勲位菊花大綬章及副章製式ノ件（明治10年太政官達第97号）
sen.e: Design of Grand Cordon of the Supreme Order of the Chrysanthemum (Dajokan Tasshi No. 97 of 1847)
Design of Grand Cordon of the Supreme Order of the Chrysanthemum (Dajokan Tasshi No. 97 of 1847)
Design of Grand Cordon of the Supreme Order of the Chrysanthemum (Dajokan Tasshi No. 97 of 1847)

sen.j: 大勲位菊花大綬章（及び副章）の製式を規定した達。
sen.e: A Tasshi defining the design of the badge and the star for the Grand Cordon of the Supreme Order of the Chrysanthemum.
A Tasshi defining the design of the badge and the star for the Grand Cordon of the Supreme Order of the Chrysanthemum.
A Tasshi defining the design of the badge and the star for the Grand Cordon of the Supreme Order of the Chrysanthemum.

sen.j: 政令としての効力を有すると解されている。
sen.e: It is interpreted as a valid Cabinet Order.
It is interpreted as a valid Cabinet Order.
It is interpreted as a valid Cabinet Order.

sen.j: 刑法（明治13年太政官布告第36号）
sen.e: Penal Code (Dajokan Fukoku No. 36 of 1850)
Penal Code (Dajokan Fukoku No. 36 of 1850)
Penal Code (Dajokan Fukoku No. 36 of 1850)

sen.j: 日本の現行刑法（明治40年法律45号）の制定に伴い廃止された旧刑法のことである。
sen.e: This old penal code was abolished and replaced by the current Penal Code (Act No. 45 of 1907).
This old penal code was abolished and replaced by the current Penal Code (Act No. 45 of 1907).
This old penal code was abolished and replaced by the current Penal Code (Act No. 45 of 1907).

sen.j: 刑法施行法（明治41年法律第29号）25条、37条により、附加刑としての剥奪公権・停止公権の内容に関する規定の一部、公選の投票を偽造する罪に関する規定が効力を有するものとされている。
sen.e: Some supplementary provisions, for example those related to deprivation and suspension of civil rights, and those related to penal offense by counterfeiting in public elections, are partially held valid by Articles 25 and 37 of the Act for Enforcement of the Penal Code (Act No. 29 of 1908).

Some supplementary provisions, for example those related to deprivation and suspension of civil rights, and those related to penal offense by counterfeiting in public elections, are partially held valid by Articles 25 and 37 of the Act for Enforcement of the Penal Code (Act No. 29 of 1908).

Some supplementary provisions, for example those related to deprivation and suspension of civil rights, and those related to penal offense by counterfeiting in public elections, are partially held valid by Articles 25 and 37 of the Act for Enforcement of the Penal Code (Act No. 29 of 1908).

sen.j: ただし、剥奪公権等の存続は、旧刑法下で科された刑の旧刑法廃止後における効力の整備を目的としたものであり、旧刑法廃止後も科すことを認めた規定ではない（各種の法律で欠格事由等として同旨のことが個別的に定められていることはあるが、刑罰としての扱いではない）。
sen.e: The validity of deprivation of civil rights, however, are kept for the purpose of maintaining the effect of punishments imposed under the old Penal Code beyond its abolition, and are not meant to be applied to newer sentences (various acts provides that a person deprived of civil rights may be treated disqualified, if not such status is treated as a conviction).
sen.cmt: 「（各種の法律で欠格事由等として同旨のことが個別的に定められていることはあるが、刑罰としての扱いではない）」の意味が不明です。「各種の法律」がどのような法律なのか、「同旨のこと」とは何とどう同旨なのか、文脈からも推測困難です。まったくの想像ですが、「公権が剥奪されている状態は欠格事由にあたるとの規定がある法律は存在するが、そのような状態は服役中と扱われているわけではない」ということかもしれません。訳文はこの意味に沿って作成しました。
sen.e: The provisions concerning the validity of deprivation of civil rights, however, are kept for the purpose of maintaining the effect of punishments imposed under the old Penal Code beyond its abolition, and are not meant to be applied to newer sentences (various acts provide that a person deprived of civil rights may be treated disqualified, but such a status is not treated as a conviction).
sen.cmt: validityが主語であれば単数名詞なので、動詞areと合いません。また主語がvarious actsであれば動詞に3単現のsはつきません。
sen.e: The provisions concerning the validity of deprivation of civil rights, however, are kept for the purpose of maintaining the effect of punishments imposed under the old Penal Code beyond its abolition, and are not meant to be applied to newer sentences (various acts provide that a person deprived of civil rights may be treated disqualified, but such a status is not treated as a conviction).

sen.j: 公選の投票については、公職選挙法の適用を受けない選挙（公法人の役員選挙など）に適用される。
sen.e: Provisions related to public elections are applicable to elections which are not subject to the Public Offices Election Act (such as elections of directors of public organizations).
Provisions related to public elections are applicable to elections which are not subject to the Public Offices Election Act (such as elections of directors of public organizations).
Provisions related to public elections are applicable to elections which are not subject to the Public Offices Election Act (such as elections of directors of public organizations).

sen.j: 褒章条例（明治14年太政官布告第63号）
sen.e: Ordinance on Medals of Honor (Dajokan Fukoku No. 63 of 1881)
Ordinance on Medals of Honor (Dajokan Fukoku No. 63 of 1881)
Ordinance on Medals of Honor (Dajokan Fukoku No. 63 of 1881)

sen.j: 栄典の一種である褒章について定めた布告。
sen.e: Awarding of Medals of Honor was promulgated.
Awarding of Medals of Honor was promulgated.
Awarding of Medals of Honor was promulgated.

sen.j: 旧憲法下では勅令により数次の改正が行われており（旧憲法下では栄典の授与は天皇大権事項）、日本国憲法下の行政解釈でも政令としての効力を有するとの解釈のもと、政令で改正されたことがある（昭和30年政令第7号、平成14年政令第278号など）。
sen.e: The regulation was revised several times by Imperial Ordinances (award giving was an Imperial prerogative under the Meiji Constitution), and was revised by Cabinet Orders (e.g. Cabinet Order No. 7 of 1955, Cabinet Order No. 278 of 2002) under the current Constitution of Japan, where the ordinance was administratively interpreted as valid.

This ordinance was revised several times by Imperial Ordinances under the Meiji Constitution (Award giving was an Imperial prerogative under the Meiji Constitution), and was revised by Cabinet Orders (e.g. Cabinet Order No. 7 of 1955, Cabinet Order No. 278 of 2002) under the current Constitution of Japan as well because the ordinance was administratively interpreted to be valid as a cabinet order.
sen.cmt: 「旧憲法下では」「政令としての（効力）」の訳漏れを修正しました。
sen.e: This ordinance was revised several times by Imperial Ordinances under the Meiji Constitution (Award giving was an Imperial prerogative under the Meiji Constitution), and was revised by Cabinet Orders (e.g. Cabinet Order No. 7 of 1955, Cabinet Order No. 278 of 2002) under the current Constitution of Japan as well because the ordinance was administratively interpreted to be valid as a cabinet order.

sen.j: しかし、法律の存在を前提とせず政令で憲法を直接実施することは認められないとの解釈が通説であり、褒章条例を政令によって改正したのは失当とする見解が呈示されている。
sen.e: Prevailing views, however, hold that any part of the Constitution may not be enforced through a Cabinet Order without the existence of an underlying law, and accordingly it is pointed out that revising the Ordinance on Medals of Honor by a Cabinet Order is inadequate.

Prevailing views, however, hold that any part of the Constitution may not be enforced through a Cabinet Order without the existence of an underlying law, and accordingly it is pointed out that this Ordinance on Medals of Honor should not have been revised by a Cabinet Order.
sen.cmt: 「改正するのは不適当である」と一般論的に述べるのではなく、「過去の改正は不適切であった」という文にします。
sen.e: Prevailing views, however, hold that any part of the Constitution may not be enforced through a Cabinet Order without the existence of an underlying law, and accordingly it is pointed out that this Ordinance on Medals of Honor should not have been revised by a Cabinet Order.

sen.j: 官報の発行（明治16年太政官達第27号）
sen.e: Publication of Official Gazette (Dajokan Tasshi No. 27 of 1883)
sen.cmt: "Japan Law Translation" での綴り"gazette"に従いました。
sen.e: Publication of Official Gazette (Dajokan Tasshi No. 27 of 1883)
Publication of Official Gazette (Dajokan Tasshi No. 27 of 1883)

sen.j: 官報を発行するとした達。
sen.e: Publication of Official Gazettes was proclaimed.

Publication of Official Gazettes was proclaimed.

sen.j: 爆発物取締罰則（明治17年太政官布告第32号）
sen.e: Penal Provisions Related to Treatment of Explosives (Dajokan Fukoku No. 32 of 1884)
Penal Provisions Related to Treatment of Explosives (Dajokan Fukoku No. 32 of 1884)
Penal Provisions Related to Treatment of Explosives (Dajokan Fukoku No. 32 of 1884)

sen.j: 治安を妨げ又は人の身体財産を害する目的による爆発物の使用等を処罰する布告。
sen.e: Provides penalties for using explosive substance for threatening public safety or for causing bodily harm to others.
Provides penalties for using explosive substance for threatening public safety or for causing bodily harm to others.
Provides penalties for using explosive substance for threatening public safety or for causing bodily harm to others.

sen.j: 法律としての効力を有する（最二昭和34年7月3日刑集13巻7号1075頁号）。
sen.e: The provisions were interpreted as a law in effect (Supreme Court Second Petty Bench Keishu Vol. 13, No. 7, p. 1075, 1959).
sen.cmt: Wikipedia より 「最二昭和34年7月3日刑集13巻7号1075頁」を補いました。（Wikipedia では "1075号" と誤記されていました。）
sen.e: The provisions were interpreted as a law in effect (Supreme Court Second Petty Bench Keishu Vol. 13, No. 7, p. 1075, 1959).
The provisions were interpreted as a law in effect (Supreme Court Second Petty Bench Keishu Vol. 13, No. 7, p. 1075, 1959).

sen.e: Convention for the Protection of Submarine Telegraph Cables (Dajokan Fukoku No. 17 of 1885)
Convention for the Protection of Submarine Telegraph Cables (Dajokan Fukoku No. 17 of 1885)
Convention for the Protection of Submarine Telegraph Cables (Dajokan Fukoku No. 17 of 1885)

sen.j: 海底電信線保護万国連合条約に加入したことを示す布告。
sen.e: Joining the Convention for the Protection of Submarine Telegraph Cables was proclaimed.
Joining the Convention for the Protection of Submarine Telegraph Cables was proclaimed.
